metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: The Government of Nepal has made the following rules in exercise of the powers conferred by Section 57 of the Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Act, 2074 published in the Nepal Gazette dated 2076/11/19.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Chapter-1

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Introduction

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 1. Short title and preamble: (1) These rules may be called the “Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076”.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) These rules shall come into force immediately.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 2. Definition: In these rules, unless the subject or context otherwise requires,-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) “Act” shall mean the Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Act, 2074.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) "Office" shall mean the Commercial, Supply and Consumer Protection Office under the Department and the term shall also include other government bodies exercising the powers delegated by the Department to carry out commercial administration work.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Chapter-2

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Provisions on Licenses

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 3. Application: A company desirous of obtaining a license for the direct sale or distribution of goods other than those mentioned in Schedule-1 shall, in addition to the documents and particulars mentioned in sub-section (1) of Section 4 of the Act, submit an application to the Department in the format of Schedule-2, attaching the following documents and particulars: (a) A copy of the certificate of Nepali citizenship of the director, (b) A tax return or tax return for the previous financial year in accordance with the prevailing Nepalese law, (c) A copy of the prevailing law or court order. Self-declaration that there is no outstanding fine, penalty or tax, and that there is no blacklist or blacklisting under this Act and other prevailing laws.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 4. Granting of License: (1) If the Department, after examining the application received under rule 3, finds it appropriate to grant the license, the Department shall order the licensee to lodge within seven days an amount equal to the value of the paid-up capital of the company to be registered and a bank guarantee of the amount specified in sub-section (1) of section 5 of the Act or a bank guarantee of the same amount. (2) Where a bank guarantee is lodged under sub-rule (1), the validity of such bank guarantee shall be three months longer than the validity of the license. (3) The Department shall issue a license in the format of Schedule-3 to the company which files the license documents and cash deposit or bank guarantee in accordance with sub-rule (1).

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 5. Increase in share capital or increase in share capital: (1) If the business carried out by the licensee exceeds five times the share capital of the company, the Department may order such licensee to increase the share capital of the company or increase the share capital. (2) In case the average turnover of the licensee for the last three financial years exceeds the authorized capital of the company, an order shall be issued to increase the authorized capital of the company within three months. (3) In case the average turnover of the licensee for the

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: last three financial years exceeds the authorized capital of the company within five months, an order shall be issued to increase the authorized capital of the company within one month. (4) The licensee shall, in accordance with the order issued by the Department under sub-rule (1), inform the Department of the increase in the paid-up capital of the business and, if additional deposit is required, shall submit it in cash or a bank guarantee of the same nature to the Department.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (5) Notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this rule, if the increase in the paid-up capital of the business is found to be less than the deposit deposited by the licensee under sub-rule (2) of section 5 of the Act, the Department may order the licensee to add the amount due to such decrease.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (6) It shall be the duty of the licensee to register any additional refund or bank guarantee under sub-rule (5) of this Act with the relevant department.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 6. Renewal of License: (1) A licensee who wishes to renew the license shall submit an application to the Department in the format of Schedule-4, at least sixty days before the expiry of the license, attaching the following supporting documents and particulars:- (a) Proof of having paid the tax return for the previous financial year or a receipt for filing the tax return,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) A cash receipt or voucher showing the amount of the renewal fee deposited in the bank account specified by the Department at the rate of one per cent of the paid-up capital of the company,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: provided that in the case of an application filed under sub-section (3) of Section 8 of the Act, the amount of the fee mentioned in this section shall be double the amount of the fee mentioned in this section. (c) If a bank guarantee has been lodged in lieu of the refund amount under rule 4, a bank guarantee letter from a reputable bank renewing or updating such bank guarantee.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) If the Department, while examining the application received under sub-rule (1), finds that the circumstances are satisfactory, it shall renew the license for a period of two years.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-rule (2), the license of a company blacklisted under section 55 of the Act shall not be renewed for the period of time it remains in the blacklist.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Chapter-3

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Various provisions to be followed by the licensee

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 7. Other dates to be observed by the licensee: In addition to the dates mentioned in Section 12 of the Act, the licensee shall also observe the following dates:- (a) Where the approval of any other body is not required under the prevailing law for the direct sale or distribution of any goods under the Act and these regulations, the transaction of direct sale or distribution of such goods shall be carried out only after obtaining the approval of such body,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) If the ownership or liability of the company is transferred or changed under Section 10 of the Act, within seven days of such transfer or change of ownership or liability.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (c) The license and the price list of the goods to be sold or distributed directly shall be kept in a visible and accessible manner at the place of business.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 8. Arrangements for physical storage: (1) The licensee shall, in accordance with the nature of the goods to be sold or distributed by him, maintain the quality of the goods and shall make necessary arrangements for physical storage to prevent the impact of the goods stored on the environment and public health.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) The licensee shall make arrangements for the necessary business software (business software) and information systems, including hardware, for the transparency and recording of all transactions related to the direct sale or distribution of goods.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (3) The business software and information systems, including hardware, used by the licensee pursuant to sub-rule (2) shall be under the control of the licensee.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (4) If the licensee is found not to have made necessary arrangements for the direct sale or distribution of goods, the Department may order the licensee to make necessary arrangements for the direct sale or distribution of goods within a period not exceeding three months.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 9. Submission of a copy of the agreement to the Department: (1) The licensee shall submit a copy of the agreement entered into with the direct seller or distributor of goods in accordance with Section 14 of the Act to the Department within seven days of the conclusion of the agreement.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) If the matters referred to in sub-section (2) of section 14 of the Act are not clarified in the agreement submitted under sub-rule (1), the Board may, within seven days, issue an order to submit the necessary matters in such agreement in a clear and transparent manner.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 10. Provision for commission or bonus: Where the licensee stipulates in the agreement entered into under Section 14 of the Act the amount of service, goods, commission and bonus to be provided to the direct seller or distributor of goods, the amount of such service, goods, commission and bonus shall be fixed in such a manner that it does not exceed forty-three percent of the selling price of the goods directly sold or distributed.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Clarification: For the purposes of this rule, the term “selling price” shall mean the price fixed

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: in such a manner as to be less than the retail price.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 11. Sale or distribution of domestic goods: (1) Where the licensee submits a detailed work plan for the direct sale of goods under clause (d) of sub-section (1) of Section 4 of the Act, such work plan shall specify that the goods of a similar nature (such as milled goods) produced domestically, which are similar to the foreign goods that he directly sells or distributes, shall be sold or distributed domestically, at a rate of fifty percent of the value of such foreign goods. (2) The licensee who sells or distributes goods in accordance with the work plan referred to in sub-rule (1) may maintain a stock of domestic or foreign goods in proportion to the value of such sale or distribution. (3) In submitting the details of direct sale or distribution of goods referred to in sub-section (2) of section 16 of the Act, the amount of sale or distribution of domestic and foreign goods shall be clearly disclosed and the value of the goods sold and the value in stock shall be added together, and the sale value of domestic goods shall be fifty percent of the total transaction value. (4) If the licensee directly sells or distributes goods not produced domestically, he shall submit to the department proof that such goods are not produced domestically and a certificate of origin issued by an official

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: bank of the country where the goods were produced. 12. Right to claim refund of purchased goods: (1) If the direct seller or distributor of the goods brought for refund under Section 17 of the Act refuses to refund the purchase price, the consumer may file a complaint with the Department in Kathmandu, in the case of Paktipuru and Lablitupuru districts, and the Supreme Court in the case of other districts, along with the bill or receipt issued by the direct seller or distributor. (2) If, on investigation of the complaint received under sub-rule (1), it is found that the complaint is false, the department or office shall immediately order the authorized direct seller or distributor to pay the outstanding amount to the consumer within seven days of the receipt of such goods under sub-section (2) of section 17 of the Act. (3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-rule (1), the goods shall not be returned in the following cases:-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) If the purchaser changes the type or quantity of the goods purchased,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) If the goods of a nature capable of being sold by using prohibited means have already been sold,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (c) If the type or type of the goods cannot be ascertained without opening the bag or packet,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: If the goods which have been delivered have been delivered in a sealed container.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Chapter-4

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Functions, duties and powers of the Department and the Director-General

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 13. Functions, duties and powers of the Department: In addition to the functions, duties and powers specified in Section 19 of the Act and elsewhere in these Rules, the following other functions, duties and powers of the Department shall be as follows:-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) To keep a record of the information received from time to time from the licensee in accordance with the Act and these Rules,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) To inquire into any objections of the user in the direct sale or distribution of goods and to issue necessary permits to the licensee or the direct seller or distributor of goods,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (c) To implement the orders issued by the Director.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 14. Complaint may be filed: (1) If any person suffers loss, damage or injury as a result of any act referred to in sub-section (2) of section 20 of the Act by any licensee or direct seller or distributor of goods, the aggrieved party may file a complaint in the form of Schedule 5 with the Department, stating the details of the loss, damage or injury suffered by him. (2) While filing a complaint under sub-rule (1), the said complaint shall be accompanied by evidence to substantiate the said claim.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Will have to do.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 15. Procedures to be followed in conducting inspection, investigation or search: (1) The inspection officer shall, before conducting any inspection, investigation or search of any place in contravention of the Act or these Rules, follow the following procedure:-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) The inspection, investigation or search shall be conducted only after giving a written notice to the licensee or the direct seller or distributor of the goods, including the documents, of the intention to conduct the inspection, investigation or search;

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) The inspection, investigation or search shall be conducted only in the country of sunrise, as far as possible;

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (c) In case of inspection, examination or search, a sample of the goods for direct sale or distribution shall be taken for testing, and a report shall be prepared with the details thereof, (d) The inspection, examination or search shall be conducted in such a manner as to avoid any loss or damage to any goods as far as possible.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) The inspection officer shall prepare a report as per Schedule-6 while conducting the inspection, examination or search in accordance with these rules.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (3) The inspection officer shall compulsorily carry his identity card with him while conducting the inspection, examination or search in accordance with these rules.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 16. Functions, duties and powers of the inspection officer: In addition to the functions, duties and powers specified in Section 22 of the Act, the other functions, duties and powers of the inspection officer are as follows:-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) To request, inquire or make inquiries from the licensee, direct seller or distributor of the goods or any person concerned for necessary details or information,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) If any person objects to the inspection, examination or search, or if it is found that such person may object, to take such person under control with the assistance of the nearest police station,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (c) To seize any material which is inspected, examined or searched, Inspect and test goods, materials, tools or equipment, (d) If it is found necessary to test a sample of any goods to be sold or distributed directly, take a sample of such goods and send it to a laboratory for testing, (e) If during inspection, inspection or search it is found that any harmful or defective goods are being produced, sold or distributed or any action is being taken against the Act or these rules, stop the production or sale of such goods for a period of thirty days or seize such goods or take them into your possession, (f) Immediately issue any order or If the order or permit is deemed appropriate, such order or permit shall be issued.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 17. Details to be included in the inspection report: The inspection officer shall include the following in the report submitted to the Department under clause (d) of sub-section (1) of section 22 of the Act:-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) The name, surname, address and address of the licensee or direct seller or distributor of the goods inspected, inspected or searched, and the reason for such inspection, inspection or search,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) The goods for direct sale or distribution found at the place of inspection, inspection or search, and other relevant details,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (c) If the goods for direct sale or distribution are seized, the reason for such seizure and the amount thereof, if any, taken into possession,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (d) The direct sale or If a sample of the goods to be distributed has been taken for quality control, the name and address of the laboratory to which the sample was sent for testing, (e) details of any order issued to the licensee or the direct seller or distributor of the goods after inspection, inspection or search.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 18. License may be revoked: (1) If the inspection authority refers the licensee for legal action under sub-section (1) of section 25 of the Act, the department may revoke the license of such licensee for a period not exceeding sixty days.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-rule (1), if, before the time mentioned in sub-rule (1), the Government Attorney receives an opinion under sub-section (3) of section 39 that the matter will not proceed, the Department shall immediately dismiss the petitioner.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 19. Functions, duties and powers of the Director General: In addition to the functions, duties and powers mentioned in sub-section (1) of Section 28 of the Act, the other functions, duties and powers of the Director General shall be as follows:-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) To authorize the Department to implement the findings obtained after conducting the study conducted under clause (a) or (b) of sub-section (1) of Section 28 of the Act,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) To authorize the Department to coordinate and cooperate with all other government and non-government bodies as may be necessary for the implementation of the Act and these rules.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 20. Meeting and other facilities: The Chairperson and members of the Steering Committee and the Chairperson and members of the Steering Committee, as provided for in Section 30 of the Act, shall be entitled to such meeting and other facilities as may be prescribed by the Government of Nepal, the Ministry of Finance, and the Ministry of Education.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Chapter-5

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Provisions for the preparation of reports and awareness raising

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 21. To operate a written contract: (1) The licensee shall, before engaging any direct seller or distributor of goods in the work prescribed by the Act and these Rules, issue a written contract on the following matters:-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) The provisions of the Act and the Rules relating to the direct sale or distribution of goods,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) The prevailing legal provisions relating to the rights of the user, the duties and responsibilities of the licensee, direct seller or distributor in the protection of the users,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (c) The functions, duties and responsibilities of the licensee and the direct seller or distributor of goods,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (d) The type of goods to be sold or distributed directly, its use (e) the services provided to the direct seller or distributor, (f) the policies, procedures and standards implemented by the Government of Nepal from time to time in the field of direct sale or distribution of goods. (2) Sub-rule (1) of the Act to maintain uniformity in the operation of the scheme

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: The Board may prepare and implement operational procedures.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 22. Awareness program to be conducted: (1) The licensee shall conduct awareness programs from time to time to make the users aware of the safety of the goods sold or distributed directly, including the following topics:-

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (a) Legal provisions regarding the safety of the goods sold or distributed directly,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (b) Provisions in the prevailing Nepal law regarding the safety of the users,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (c) Functions, duties and responsibilities of the licensee and the direct seller or distributor of the goods towards the users of the goods,

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (d) Procedures for redress in case the licensee and the direct seller or distributor of the goods act contrary to the users’ rights.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) The licensee shall broadcast and publish the approved awareness-raising advertisement on local FM radio, table business and newspapers as per the requirement for awareness of the users.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (3) Notwithstanding anything written elsewhere in these rules, the department may conduct various awareness-raising programs from time to time in the direct sale or distribution of goods subject to the Act and these rules.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Chapter-6

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Provisions for the prevention of drug abuse

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 23. To investigate a complaint: (1) If a complaint is filed under Section 38 of the Act, the Inspection Authority may obtain necessary preliminary information from the complainant regarding the validity or truth of such complaint. (2) If, on the basis of the information received under sub-rule (1), it appears prima facie that the complainant has suffered or is likely to suffer loss or damage due to the non-performance of the duties of a licensee or direct seller or distributor, the Inspection Authority shall, as soon as possible, commence an investigation into the matter. 24. Investigation: (1) The inspection officer conducting an investigation into a complaint filed under Section 38 of the Act may exercise the powers conferred on him under Section 22 of the Act and Rule 16 of these Rules.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) The inspection officer may, during the course of the investigation, take photographs or audio-visual records of the place or thing inspected, examined or searched.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (3) The inspection officer shall search the premises of the potential licensee or direct seller or distributor.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (4) After the search operation under sub-rule (3) is completed, a warrant shall be drawn up in the format of Schedule-6 and the licensee or direct seller or distributor shall be present and the same shall be signed and stamped by the inspector. If any sample of any item is taken or seized during the search, it shall also be mentioned in the search warrant. (5) The inspection officer may, in order to collect necessary evidence during the investigation, seize any document or item in question or arrest any person, suspect or accused and cause such person to produce any document. (6) The inspection officer may, during the course of the investigation, enter the premises where the goods are kept for direct sale or distribution, send a sample of such goods for testing and, if the results are received, or, if otherwise ordered by the court, file a complaint, and prohibit the direct sale or distribution of such goods.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (7) In accordance with the Act and these Rules, the Inspection Officer may, if the evidence obtained immediately after the inspection by the authorized licensee or direct seller or distributor is sufficient to prove the guilt of the accused, open the case and keep it on a fixed date, release it without taking any money or bail or keep it in a place approved by the authorized District Court and conduct the inspection.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (8) After completing the inspection work, the Inspection Officer shall prepare an inspection report including the evidence obtained and submit it to the Government Attorney for his opinion on whether to prosecute the case.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 25. Testing of Samples: (1) In the course of the investigation, if any sample of an article is taken by the Investigation Officer, the details in the format of Schedule-7 shall be sent to a laboratory established or not by the Government of Nepal for testing as soon as possible, so as not to adversely affect the nature or quality of such article. (2) After testing the sample received under sub-rule (1), the laboratory shall send a report in the format of Schedule-8 to the Department, including the results of the test of such sample of the article. 26. Information to be given: If, while examining the inquiry report received by the Inspection Authority under sub-rule (8) of rule 24, it is decided that the Government Attorney will not proceed with the investigation against the licensee or the direct seller or distributor of the goods, the Inspection Authority shall give information thereof to the complainant within seven days. 27. Government of Nepal not liable: The Government of Nepal shall not be liable for any loss or damage suffered by the licensee or direct seller or distributor due to the loss or damage of any goods seized or seized during the course of inspection, investigation, search or inquiry conducted in accordance with the Act and these regulations. 28. Release of seized or detained goods: If, in the course of inspection, investigation, search or inquiry conducted under the Act and these Rules, a sample of any goods seized or detained under the Act or these Rules is found to be in conformity with the prescribed standards or specifications for use, the inspection authority shall immediately release the ban imposed on the direct sale or distribution of such goods.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 29. Obeying the order of the Inspection Authority: If the Inspection Authority has given any order to any person during the hearing under these rules, it shall be the duty of such person to comply with such order.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: Chapter-7

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 30. Classification of Licensee: The Department shall issue a license The licensee may be classified on the basis of the paid-up capital of the company, the amount of the transaction and the number of sellers or distributors.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 31. Social security: The licensee shall provide social security to the persons involved in the direct sale or distribution of goods, in accordance with the prevailing law.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 32. Records to be kept: (1) The licensee shall keep a record of all transactions of direct sale or distribution of goods and the details of the direct sellers or distributors of the goods in the format specified in Schedule-9.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) The licensee may keep the records of the licensee in the electronic system as per sub-rule (1). Such records may be inspected, inspected or checked by the department or the inspection authority at any time as per the requirement.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (3) The licensee shall submit the report under sub-section (2) of section 45 of the Act in the format of Schedule-10.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 33. Filing of records and keeping of records: The department shall keep the records of the licensee in the format of Schedule-11, updated with the details received from time to time under section 46 of the Act.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 34. Details may be changed: (1) If the licensee wishes to change any general details mentioned in the license, he shall submit an application to the Department in the format of Schedule-12 along with a fee of five hundred rupees.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) If the content of the application received under sub-rule (1) is not satisfactory, the Department shall change such details and inform the licensee thereof.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (3) If it is found that any details cannot be changed in the application made under sub-rule (1), the Department shall inform the licensee thereof within seven days of the date of the application, including the reason for doing so.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 35. Copy of License: (1) If a copy of the license is required for the purpose mentioned in Section 51 of the Act, the licensee shall submit an application to the Department stating the reason for the request.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) If the application received under sub-rule (1) is found to be false, the Department shall provide a copy of the license to the licensee on payment of a fee of five hundred rupees. 36. May use electronic means: The Department may make necessary arrangements to enable the execution of all activities related to direct sale or distribution of goods under the Act and these rules through electronic means or online platforms.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 37. Submission of report: The department shall submit a quarterly report of its work done in accordance with Section 54 of the Act to the Ministry in the format of Schedule-13.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 38. Blacklisting: (1) If, on examination of the details or documents submitted by any company for obtaining a license in accordance with the Act and these rules, such details or documents are found to be false, the department may blacklist such company for a period of two years.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (2) The information on blacklisting in accordance with sub-rule (1) shall be made public.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: (3) The company blacklisted under sub-rule (1) shall be subject to legal action under other prevailing laws and shall be sent to the competent authority for further action.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf

text: 39. Modification or addition to the list may be made: The Ministry may make necessary modifications or additions to the list by publishing a notification in the Nepal Gazette.

metadata.filename: Direct Sale of Goods (Management and Regulation) Rules, 2076.pdf
